urls.title: Environment Agency drops pollution incident reporting
urls.description: The Environment Agency (EA) has changed the way it reports its corporate performance, dropping a goal of reducing pollution incidents while introducing climate adaptation and air quality targets.

urls.title: Why the EA is under fire over hazardous waste in a Saxon pit
urls.description: If the Environment Agency thought it could bury the small matter of 122,000 tonnes of waste deposited on the site of an old brickworks just outside the north Cambridgeshire town of Whittlesey ‚Äì waste subsequently revealed to contain significant quantities of hazardous chemicals ‚Äì then it was mistaken.

tweets.text: @scottdegg @markeltro @BBCRadioStoke @EnvAgency @NewsNBC @AaronBell4NUL @JamesBevanEA @StinkStopthe @StaffsFire Air quality is horrendous, not surprised about illness it caused, hope the environment agency will look at this in detail, so close to residential properties has to be an hazard & detriment to health.

A new flow gauge station is being planned on the River Parrett in Langport, by @EnvAgencySW with SRA funding.   It will benefit the whole catchment area above Langport for the Parrett, Isle, Yeo & their tributaries (=770 square kilometres). Langport's in blue on the old map below https://t.co/6petRVboz7

Now ground investigation done for Langport flow station, building due this summer @EnvAgencySW. Better data about water going thro' Langport (+ info from Chiselborough, Yeovil, Donyatt & Stathe) will make for better use of water control structures & stronger flood warning systems https://t.co/jnjvLFdSly

Our Partnership Officer, Kate, has been carrying out sediment walkover surveys this winter. This work, part of @EnvAgencyYNE 's Doing More for the Derwent Project, will help identify any interventions that would reduce sediment input in the watercourse! https://t.co/ve5DRkcLao

urls.title: Direct Air Capture and other Greenhouse Gas Removal technologies competition
urls.description: This competition will provide funding for developing technologies that enable the removal of greenhouse gases from the atmosphere in the UK.

tweets.text: The government is looking for technical solutions to absorb CO2. Here is a simple one from nature - #WETLANDS the most effective carbon sink on Earth. https://t.co/ih7KQEjJ5O

@JoKingDevon @JohnWright100 @Feargal_Sharkey @Teignbridge @EnvAgencySW Generally a breach will be classified Category 1 to 4, a 4 is no pollution  a small breach eg 50mg/l suspended solids for a limit of 40mg/l. You get a compliance classification score. Depending on how many points you get defines your Site banding and the cost of your subsistence.
